searchDocs.title: Force​
searchDocs.content: </> BouncePadObject.Force: number How far up to bounce the player. This has a default value of 10.

searchDocs.title: Cooldown​
searchDocs.content: </> BouncePadObject.Cooldown: number How long to wait before letting the player bounce again. This has a default value of 0.2.

searchDocs.title: Damage​
searchDocs.content: </> DamageBrickObject.Damage: number How much to damage the player. This has a default value of 10.

searchDocs.title: Cooldown​
searchDocs.content: </> DamageBrickObject.Cooldown: number How long to wait before damaging the player again. This has a default value of 0.2.

searchDocs.title: Collect​
searchDocs.content: </> EventsAPI.Collect( Object: Instance ,-- The object to collect events for. EventName: string-- The event to collect results for. ) → {any} Collects all results of an object's event.

searchDocs.title: DisappearTime​
searchDocs.content: </> DisappearingPlatformObject.DisappearTime: number How much time it takes for the platform to disappear. This has a default value of 1.

searchDocs.title: RespawnTime​
searchDocs.content: </> DisappearingPlatformObject.RespawnTime: number How much time it takes for the platform to reappear. This has a default value of 2.

searchDocs.title: Cooldown​
searchDocs.content: </> DisappearingPlatformObject.Cooldown: number How long to wait before damaging the player again. This has a default value of 0.2.

searchDocs.title: Speed​
searchDocs.content: </> MovingPlatformObject.Speed: number How fast the platform moves. This has a default value of 50.

searchDocs.title: FrameConsistent​
searchDocs.content: </> MovingPlatformObject.FrameConsistent: boolean If the speed should be consistent, even if lag occurs. This has a default value of true.

searchDocs.title: SeamlessLoop​
searchDocs.content: </> MovingPlatformObject.SeamlessLoop: boolean If the platform should loop around or reverse after finishing a lap. This has a default value of true.

searchDocs.title: Weld​
searchDocs.content: </> PhysicsAPI.Weld( Part0: BasePart ,-- The part to weld everything to. Parts: {BasePart }-- The parts to weld. ) → () Welds a table of BaseParts to another BasePart.

searchDocs.title: Enabled​
searchDocs.content: </> OneWayPlatformObject.Enabled: boolean Whether or not to change collisions. This has a default value of true.

searchDocs.title: Buffer​
searchDocs.content: </> OneWayPlatformObject.Buffer: number How far the player should be before collision is turned off. This has a default value of 0.1.

searchDocs.title: Speed​
searchDocs.content: </> ConveyorObject.Speed: number How fast to push the player. This has a default value of 20.

searchDocs.title: FrameConsistent​
searchDocs.content: </> ConveyorObject.FrameConsistent: boolean If the speed should be consistent, even if lag occurs. This has a default value of true.

searchDocs.title: EnsureDefaults​
searchDocs.content: </> MiscAPI.EnsureDefaults( Defaults: {any},-- The defaults to ensure. Table: {any}-- The table to ensure. ) → () Ensures the default of a table.

searchDocs.title: EnsureInstance​
searchDocs.content: </> MiscAPI.EnsureInstance( Parent: Instance ,-- The parent to check. ObjectName: string-- The object name to check. ) → () Ensures an instance exists.

searchDocs.title: UseThrottle​
searchDocs.content: </> MiscAPI.UseThrottle( ID: any,-- The ID to check. Cooldown: number-- The cooldown. ) → boolean-- Whether or not the ID is throttled. Returns true if an ID is not throttled.

searchDocs.title: Cooldown​
searchDocs.content: </> RedirectOrbObject.Cooldown: number How long to wait before flinging the player again. This has a default value of 1.

searchDocs.title: Modifier​
searchDocs.content: </> RedirectOrbObject.Modifier: number How much to multiply the player's initial velocity by. This has a default value of 2.

searchDocs.title: GetCharacter​
searchDocs.content: </> PlayerAPI.GetCharacter() → Model? -- The player's character. Gets the player's character.

searchDocs.title: GetDeltaTime​
searchDocs.content: </> PlayerAPI.GetDeltaTime() → number-- The current DeltaTime. Gets the current DeltaTime.

searchDocs.title: IsPlayerPart​
searchDocs.content: </> PlayerAPI.IsPlayerPart( Part: BasePart -- The part that belongs to a player. ) → ( boolean,-- If the part belongs to a player. Player? -- The player the part belongs to. Can be nil. ) Checks if a specified part belongs to a player.

searchDocs.title: Speed​
searchDocs.content: </> SpinnerObject.Speed: number How fast to spin the spinner. This has a default value of 150.

searchDocs.title: Axis​
searchDocs.content: </> SpinnerObject.Axis: Vector3  The direction to move the spinner in. This has a default value of Vector3.new(0, 1, 0).

searchDocs.title: FrameConsistent​
searchDocs.content: </> SpinnerObject.FrameConsistent: boolean If the speed should stay consistent, even if lag occurs. This has a default value of true.

searchDocs.title: new​
searchDocs.content: </> SchedulerClass.new( Scope: string-- The scope to use for the new scheduler. ) → () Create a new Scheduler.

searchDocs.title: AddSystem​
searchDocs.content: </> SchedulerClass.AddSystem( self: Scheduler, System: {} | ModuleScript ,-- The system to add to the scheduler. SystemName: string-- The name of the system to add. ) → () Add a system to the scheduler.

searchDocs.title: RemoveSystem​
searchDocs.content: </> SchedulerClass.RemoveSystem( self: Scheduler, SystemName: string-- The name of the system to remove. ) → () Removes a system from the scheduler.

searchDocs.title: Step​
searchDocs.content: </> SchedulerClass.Step( self: Scheduler, Function: string,-- The function name to call. StepMode: string?-- The step mode to check for. ) → () Steps the scheduler.

searchDocs.title: SetRuntimes​
searchDocs.content: </> SchedulerClass.SetRuntimes( self: Scheduler, Runtimes: {string}-- The runtimes to set. ) → () Sets the scheduler's valid runtimes.

searchDocs.title: Start​
searchDocs.content: </> SchedulerClass.Start(self: Scheduler) → () Starts the scheduler.

searchDocs.title: Cooldown​
searchDocs.content: </> TeleporterObject.Cooldown: number How long to wait before teleporting the player again. This has a default value of 1.

searchDocs.title: Offset​
searchDocs.content: </> TeleporterObject.Offset: CFrame  The offset the player should be teleported with. This has a default value of CFrame.new(0, 0, 0).

searchDocs.title: Seamless​
searchDocs.content: </> TeleporterObject.Seamless: boolean If the player should come out at the same relative position/orientation as they came in with. This has a default value of true.

searchDocs.title: KeepVelocity​
searchDocs.content: </> TeleporterObject.KeepVelocity: boolean If the player should keep their velocity, even after teleporting. This has a default value of true.

searchDocs.title: Speed​
searchDocs.content: </> ZiplineObject.Speed: number How fast the player should move across the zipline. This has a default value of 25.

searchDocs.title: Cooldown​
searchDocs.content: </> ZiplineObject.Cooldown: number How long to wait before letting the player move across the zipline again. This has a default value of 1.

searchDocs.title: Points​
searchDocs.content: </> ZiplineObject.Points: number How many points the rope path should have. This has a default value of 10.

searchDocs.title: Guidelines​
searchDocs.content: Your custom object must be optimised for low-end devices.Your custom object must not be disruptive to the player's experience in major ways. If broken, this will get you banned from submitting Spires.Your custom object must not have any malicious intent or effects. If broken, this will get you banned from submitting Spires.

searchDocs.title: Tips and Tricks​
searchDocs.content: Want to add EToH v5.5 and v6 Client object support? You can remove the "Step" function and the system will work fine!Your "StepMode" can be any event under RunService. This includes RenderStepped, Heartbeat, etc!Your Configuration can have any type that's compatible with Attributes.

searchDocs.title: Introduction
searchDocs.content: Introduction Welcome to the Spire Kit documentation! This should tell you everything you need to know about the kit, including how to set it up, detailed documentation on the objects and API, and more! This site is heavily inspired by the EToH V6 Kit Documentation, so check it out!

searchDocs.title: Template
searchDocs.content: Template This is how to make a spinner: local System = {} local Object = nil System.Configuration = { Speed = 1 } System.StepMode = "PreRender" -- Any event under RunService! local Root = nil function System:Init(API, Configuration) Object = API.Misc.EnsureInstance(script, "ObjectPath").Value Root = API.Misc.EnsureInstance(Object, "Root") System.Configuration = API.Misc.EnsureDefaults(System.Configuration, Object:GetAttributes()) end function System:Step(API, Configuration) if not Root then return end local Speed = Configuration.Speed Root.CFrame *= CFrame.new(0, Speed, 0) end return System

searchDocs.title: Bounce Pad
searchDocs.content: Bounce Pad Bounce Pads make the player bounce up in the air when touched. Name	Default Value	DescriptionForce	10	How far up to bounce the player. Cooldown	0.2	How long to wait before letting the player bounce again.

searchDocs.title: Conveyor
searchDocs.content: Conveyor Conveyors push the player along while the player is in contact. Name	Default Value	DescriptionSpeed	20	How fast to push the player. FrameConsistent	true	If the speed should be consistent, even if lag occurs.

searchDocs.title: Damage Brick
searchDocs.content: Damage Brick Damage Bricks damage the player when in contact. Name	Default Value	DescriptionDamage	10	How much to damage the player. Cooldown	0.2	How long to wait before damaging the player again.

searchDocs.title: Disappearing Platform
searchDocs.content: Disappearing Platform Disappearing Platforms fade when in contact with a player. Name	Default Value	DescriptionDisappearTime	1	How much time it takes for the platform to disappear. RespawnTime	2	How much time it takes for the platform to reappear. Cooldown	0.2	How long to wait before damaging the player again.

searchDocs.title: Moving Platform
searchDocs.content: Moving Platform Moving Platforms continually move inbetween a dynamic amount of points. Name	Default Value	DescriptionSpeed	50	How fast the platform moves. FrameConsistent	true	If the speed should be consistent, even if lag occurs. SeamlessLoop	true	If the platform should loop around or reverse after finishing a lap.

searchDocs.title: One Way Platform
searchDocs.content: One Way Platform One Way Platforms can only be moved through in one direction. Name	Default Value	DescriptionEnabled	true	Whether or not to change collisions. Buffer	0.1	How far the player should be before collision is turned off.

searchDocs.title: Redirect Orb
searchDocs.content: Redirect Orb When touched, Redirect Orbs fling the player in a different trajectory, but with the same velocity. Name	Default Value	DescriptionCooldown	1	How long to wait before flinging the player again. Modifier	2	How much to multiply the player's initial velocity by.

searchDocs.title: Spinner
searchDocs.content: Spinner Spinners continually spin in a specified direction, moving a player with it. Name	Default Value	DescriptionSpeed	150	How fast to spin the spinner. Axis	Vector3.new(0, 1, 0)	The direction to move the spinner in. FrameConsistent	true	If the speed should stay consistent, even if lag occurs.

searchDocs.title: Teleporter
searchDocs.content: Teleporter When the origin part is touched, Teleporters teleport the player to the Destination part. Name	Default Value	DescriptionCooldown	1	How long to wait before teleporting the player again. Offset	CFrame.new(0, 0, 0)	The offset the player should be teleported with. Seamless	true	If the speed should be consistent, even if lag occurs. KeepVelocity	true	If the player should keep their velocity, even after teleporting.

searchDocs.title: Zipline
searchDocs.content: Zipline When the hitbox is touched, the player moves along the zipline smoothly. Name	Default Value	DescriptionSpeed	25	How fast the player should move across the zipline. Cooldown	1	How long to wait before letting the player move across the zipline again. Points	10	How many points the rope path should have.
